plot: When Irish ventriloquist Jonathan West cannot find any work, his dummy Caesar suggests that he turn to burglary.

Ventriloquist Jonathan West isn't having much luck finding a job. He's gone to several auditions but no one has taken him on. He's falling behind in his rent and is now getting to the point where he's running out of things to pawn. He has to put up with the taunts of young Susan, the landlady's niece. He's also talking to his dummy, Caesar, who has advice for him on how to get ahead. It's not very good advice however.—garykmcd / edited by Rob

Jonathan West is an Irish ventriloquist that lives in a boarding house. He is a loser and cannot find a job with his dummy Caesar. Out of the blue, Caesar suggests that Jonathan should robber a store to pay his bills. But the nosy niece of Agnes Cudahy, Susan, is overhearing their conversation.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
